sentences: Tema kaartidel on alati hea 천nn.
context: The word 'vedas' is the third person singular past tense of the verb 'vedama' in Estonian. It means 'had luck', 'was lucky', or 'succeeded'. This form indicates that someone experienced good fortune or success at some point in the past. For example, when we say 'Mul vedas v채ga' it means 'I had a lot of luck' or 'It went very well for me'.
